examples.sentence: 戻る (modoru) - to return, go back

sections.heading: Pattern 1: X は Y です (X is Y)
sections.content:
Structure: [Topic] は [Noun/Adjective] です Meaning: "X is Y" or "As for X, it's Y"

The most basic pattern for stating facts and introducing yourself.

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 私は学生です。 Watashi wa gakusei desu. I (topic) student am. "I am a student." これは本です。 Kore wa hon desu. This (topic) book is. "This is a book." 東京は大きいです。 Toukyou wa ookii desu. Tokyo (topic) big is. "Tokyo is big."

children.heading: Making it Negative
children.content:
Add じゃないです (janai desu) or じゃありません (ja arimasen):

私は学生じゃないです。 Watashi wa gakusei janai desu. "I'm not a student." これは本じゃありません。 Kore wa hon ja arimasen. "This is not a book."

children.heading: Making it Past Tense
children.content:
Change です to でした (deshita):

私は学生でした。 Watashi wa gakusei deshita. "I was a student." 東京は寒かったです。 Toukyou wa samukatta desu. "Tokyo was cold."

sections.heading: Pattern 2: X は Y を V (X does V to Y)
sections.content:
Structure: [Topic] は [Object] を [Verb] Meaning: "X does [verb] to Y"

This pattern describes actions with direct objects.

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 私は本を読みます。 Watashi wa hon wo yomimasu. I (topic) book (object) read. "I read books." 田中さんはコーヒーを飲みます。 Tanaka-san wa ko-hi- wo nomimasu. "Tanaka drinks coffee." 学生は日本語を勉強します。 Gakusei wa nihongo wo benkyou shimasu. "Students study Japanese."

children.heading: Common Verbs
children.content: 食べる (taberu) - to eat 飲む (nomu) - to drink 見る (miru) - to see/watch 聞く (kiku) - to listen/hear 読む (yomu) - to read 書く (kaku) - to write 買う (kau) - to buy

children.heading: Making it Negative
children.content:
Change ます to ません:

私は本を読みません。 Watashi wa hon wo yomimasen. "I don't read books." コーヒーを飲みません。 Ko-hi- wo nomimasen. "I don't drink coffee."

children.heading: Making it Past Tense
children.content:
Change ます to ました:

私は本を読みました。 Watashi wa hon wo yomimashita. "I read a book."

sections.heading: Pattern 3: X に Y があります/います (Y exists at X)
sections.content:
Structure: [Location] に [Thing] が あります/います Meaning: "There is Y at/in X" or "Y exists at X"

Use あります (arimasu) for inanimate objects, います (imasu) for living things.

children.heading: Examples - Inanimate (あります)
children.content: 机の上に本があります。 Tsukue no ue ni hon ga arimasu. Desk top on book exists. "There is a book on the desk." 冷蔵庫に牛乳があります。 Reizouko ni gyuunyuu ga arimasu. "There is milk in the refrigerator." 駅の近くにコンビニがあります。 Eki no chikaku ni konbini ga arimasu. "There's a convenience store near the station."

children.heading: Examples - Animate (います)
children.content: 部屋に猫がいます。 Heya ni neko ga imasu. Room in cat exists. "There is a cat in the room." 公園に子供がいます。 Kouen ni kodomo ga imasu. "There are children in the park." 教室に先生がいます。 Kyoushitsu ni sensei ga imasu. "There is a teacher in the classroom."

children.heading: Common Location Words
children.content: 上 (ue) - on top, above 下 (shita) - under, below 中 (naka) - inside 外 (soto) - outside 前 (mae) - in front 後ろ (ushiro) - behind 隣 (tonari) - next to 近く (chikaku) - near

sections.heading: Pattern 4: X は Y が好きです (X likes Y)
sections.content:
Structure: [Topic] は [Thing] が 好きです Meaning: "X likes Y"

Use が (ga) to mark what you like, not を (wo).

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 私は寿司が好きです。 Watashi wa sushi ga suki desu. I (topic) sushi (subject) like. "I like sushi." 田中さんは音楽が好きです。 Tanaka-san wa ongaku ga suki desu. "Tanaka likes music." 猫が好きです。 Neko ga suki desu. "I like cats." [Subject implied]

children.heading: Dislike - 嫌い (kirai)
children.content: 私は野菜が嫌いです。 Watashi wa yasai ga kirai desu. "I dislike vegetables."

children.heading: Degrees of Like/Dislike
children.content: 大好き (daisuki) - love, really like 好き (suki) - like 嫌い (kirai) - dislike 大嫌い (daikirai) - hate, really dislike

sections.heading: Pattern 5: X は Y ができます (X can do Y)
sections.content: Structure: [Topic] は [Ability] が できます Meaning: "X can do Y" or "X is able to Y"

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 私は日本語ができます。 Watashi wa nihongo ga dekimasu. I (topic) Japanese (subject) can. "I can speak Japanese." 田中さんは料理ができます。 Tanaka-san wa ryouri ga dekimasu. "Tanaka can cook." 泳ぐことができます。 Oyogu koto ga dekimasu. "I can swim." [Literally: "swimming thing can do"]

children.heading: Negative - Cannot
children.content: 私は運転ができません。 Watashi wa unten ga dekimasen. "I cannot drive."

sections.heading: Pattern 6: X へ/に 行きます (Go to X)
sections.content:
Structure: [Place] へ/に 行きます/来ます Meaning: "Go to X" or "Come to X"

Use へ (e) or に (ni) for destination.

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 学校に行きます。 Gakkou ni ikimasu. School to go. "I go to school." 日本へ行きます。 Nihon e ikimasu. "I will go to Japan." 家に帰ります。 Ie ni kaerimasu. "I return home." ここに来ます。 Koko ni kimasu. "I come here."

children.heading: Common Verbs of Movement
children.content: 行く (iku) - to go 来る (kuru) - to come 帰る (kaeru) - to return home 戻る (modoru) - to return, go back

sections.heading: Pattern 7: X で Y をします (Do Y at/with X)
sections.content:
Structure: [Place/Means] で [Action] をします Meaning: "Do Y at X" or "Do Y by means of X"

The particle で marks location of action or means.

children.heading: Examples - Location
children.content: 図書館で勉強します。 Toshokan de benkyou shimasu. Library at study do. "I study at the library." レストランで食べます。 Resutoran de tabemasu. "I eat at a restaurant."

children.heading: Examples - Means/Tool
children.content: ペンで書きます。 Pen de kakimasu. Pen with write. "I write with a pen." 日本語で話します。 Nihongo de hanashimasu. "I speak in Japanese." 電車で行きます。 Densha de ikimasu. "I go by train."

sections.heading: Pattern 8: X は Y に Z をあげます (X gives Z to Y)
sections.content: Structure: [Giver] は [Receiver] に [Thing] を あげます Meaning: "X gives Z to Y"

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 私は友達にプレゼントをあげます。 Watashi wa tomodachi ni purezento wo agemasu. I (topic) friend (to) present (object) give. "I give a present to my friend." 先生は学生に本をあげます。 Sensei wa gakusei ni hon wo agemasu. "The teacher gives books to students."

children.heading: Receiving - もらいます (moraimasu)
children.content:
私は友達にプレゼントをもらいます。 Watashi wa tomodachi ni purezento wo moraimasu. "I receive a present from my friend."

See: Giving and Receiving Verbs for more detail

sections.heading: Pattern 9: X は Y が欲しいです (X wants Y)
sections.content: Structure: [Topic] は [Thing] が 欲しいです Meaning: "X wants Y" (for things)

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 私は新しい車が欲しいです。 Watashi wa atarashii kuruma ga hoshii desu. I (topic) new car (subject) want. "I want a new car." 水が欲しいです。 Mizu ga hoshii desu. "I want water."

children.heading: Want to DO something - たい (tai)
children.content:
For actions, use verb stem + たい:

寿司を食べたいです。 Sushi wo tabetai desu. "I want to eat sushi." 日本に行きたいです。 Nihon ni ikitai desu. "I want to go to Japan."

See: Expressing Desires for complete guide

sections.heading: Pattern 10: Question Pattern
sections.content:
Structure: [Statement] + か Meaning: Turns statement into question

Simply add か (ka) to the end.

children.heading: Examples
children.content: これは本ですか？ Kore wa hon desu ka? "Is this a book?" 日本語が分かりますか？ Nihongo ga wakarimasu ka? "Do you understand Japanese?" どこに行きますか？ Doko ni ikimasu ka? "Where are you going?"

children.heading: Question Words
children.content:
何 (nani/nan) - what 誰 (dare) - who どこ (doko) - where いつ (itsu) - when どうして/なぜ (doushite/naze) - why どう (dou) - how

See: Question Patterns for detailed guide

sections.heading: Combining Patterns
sections.content:
Real sentences often combine multiple patterns:

私は図書館で日本語の本を読みました。 Watashi wa toshokan de nihongo no hon wo yomimashita. "I read a Japanese book at the library." [Pattern 2: を Verb] + [Pattern 7: で location]

田中さんは寿司が好きですが、私は嫌いです。 Tanaka-san wa sushi ga suki desu ga, watashi wa kirai desu. "Tanaka likes sushi, but I dislike it." [Pattern 4: Likes] + が (but) + [Pattern 4: Dislikes]

sections.heading: Practice Exercises
sections.content: Try creating sentences with these patterns:

children.heading: Exercise 1: Introduction
children.content:
Use Pattern 1 to introduce yourself:

I am [your name] I am a student I am from [country]

children.heading: Exercise 2: Daily Actions
children.content:
Use Pattern 2 with these verbs:

食べる (eat) 見る (watch/see) 勉強する (study)

children.heading: Exercise 3: Locations
children.content:
Use Pattern 3 to describe your room:

There is a desk There is a computer There is a chair

children.heading: Exercise 4: Preferences
children.content:
Use Pattern 4 for likes/dislikes:

I like coffee I dislike vegetables I love music

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong Particle
children.content:
Wrong: 私は本が読みます ❌ Right: 私は本を読みます ✓

Use を for direct objects of action verbs.

children.heading: Mistake 2: Missing Topic
children.content:
Wrong: 学生です ❌ (without context) Right: 私は学生です ✓

Include は topic marker when introducing new information.

children.heading: Mistake 3: が vs を with 好き
children.content:
Wrong: 寿司を好きです ❌ Right: 寿司が好きです ✓

好き、嫌い、上手、下手 always use が.

children.heading: Mistake 4: あります vs います
children.content:
Wrong: 部屋に猫があります ❌ Right: 部屋に猫がいます ✓

Living things use います, inanimate objects use あります.

sections.heading: Summary Chart
sections.content: | Pattern | Structure | Example | Meaning | | ------- | -------------------- | ---------------- | ------------- | | 1 | X は Y です | 私は学生です | X is Y | | 2 | X は Y を V | 本を読みます | Do V to Y | | 3 | X に Y があります | 机に本がある | Y exists at X | | 4 | X は Y が好き | 寿司が好き | X likes Y | | 5 | X は Y ができる | 日本語ができる | X can do Y | | 6 | X へ/に 行く | 学校に行く | Go to X | | 7 | X で Y をする | 図書館で勉強 | Do Y at X | | 8 | X は Y に Z をあげる | 友達に本をあげる | Give Z to Y | | 9 | X は Y が欲しい | 車が欲しい | Want Y | | 10 | Statement + か | 学生ですか | Question |
